page.title: 18PAROCHIAL CHURCH COUNCIL
page.content: The Secretary to the P.C.C. talked to us about her work. There was no P.C.C. before 1914. The Church was run by the rich people or the Lord of the Manor. Now the members are elected by the village. They have to look after the church buildings, the vicar's robes, everything inside the church.They have to pay the bills for electricity, damage repairs, maintain the organ and piano and buy candles. They get the money from donations, wills and collections at swrvices. The latest expense was for a new central heating system and we went down from school to see it being put in and to see the new electric boiler. The P.C.C. has to appoint a Captain of Bells who arranges the practices and makes sure the bells are pealed on Sunday. Some of the school children are learning to ring.
